I was stunned when I saw t=
he photo, and then blew it up and looked at it more closely. And like I sai=
d, I saw it *on* the camera, still *on* the memory card myself.=A0 I'm a ho=
bbist photographer/designer, with quite a bit of knowledge about Photoshop/=
etc.=A0 My niece, on the other hand, knows how to point and shoot a camera,=
 and download them to her computer. That's it.=A0 I have had several profes=
sional photographers view it, as well as some of my graphics friends. We al=
l agreed that it was definitely "something to behold!" 

The picture was ta=
ken it was Feb. of 2007, and it was still quite chilly in Florida. In fact,=
 in all the pics you can see my family members with their jackets on! There=
 were no bugs out, etc.=A0 Nothing else out of the ordinary showed up in an=
y of the other photographs, either the ones taken right before this shot, o=
r after this shot, or in the whole trip.

Interesting, isn't it?

Becca

<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" ><tr><td valign="top" style="font: inherit;">Sure. I'll share two links to the same pic, as I'm not sure which way I should post it to the group for "clickability". <br><br>In this link you get the whole picture - that's the front of my cousin's home:<br>http://img.photobucket.com/albums/0903/BecPellor/the_pixie.jpg<br>http://smg.photobucket.com/albums/0903/BecPellor/?action=view&current=the_pixie.jpg<br><br>In this one you'll see it cropped,  closer up:<br>http://img.photobucket.com/albums/0903/BecPellor/picture1.jpg<br>http://smg.photobucket.com/albums/0903/BecPellor/?action=view&current=picture1.jpg<br><br>This one even closer:<br>http://img.photobucket.com/albums/0903/BecPellor/picture2.jpg<br>http://smg.photobucket.com/albums/0903/BecPellor/?action=view&current=picture2.jpg<br><br>I was stunned when I saw the photo, and then blew it up and looked at it more closely. And like I said,
 I saw it *on* the camera, still *on* the memory card myself.  I'm a hobbist photographer/designer, with quite a bit of knowledge about Photoshop/etc.  My niece, on the other hand, knows how to point and shoot a camera, and download them to her computer. That's it.  I have had several professional photographers view it, as well as some of my graphics friends. We all agreed that it was definitely "something to behold!" <br><br>The picture was taken it was Feb. of 2007, and it was still quite chilly in Florida. In fact, in all the pics you can see my family members with their jackets on! There were no bugs out, etc.  Nothing else out of the ordinary showed up in any of the other photographs, either the ones taken right before this shot, or after this shot, or in the whole trip.<br><br>Interesting, isn't it?<br><br>Becca<br><br></td></tr></table><br>
